content.description: Start on an enormous left facing jug that sits below the arete. Work your way up the arete using the enormous undercling just above the start. after reaching the top of the arete start heading left for an easy top out. You can make this problem as difficult or as easy as you want since there is a bunch of stuff off on the sides.
content.location: To the left of Gumby about 10 to 15 feet. This is on the North side of the New Meadow (on the right when you exit the tunnel).

content.description: This is the forgotten start to Speed Bump. Start in the large hueco down and right of Speed Bump by pressing yourself into this traffic circle. Hands and feet should be inside the hueco, don't use the low skirt for feet. Puzzle your way into the start of Speed Bump and continue on.
content.location: Start back and right of Speed Bump in the large hueco.

content.description: Start on an obvious low rail and climb directly up on sharp crimps
content.location: 15 feet left of Speed Bump on the same boulder

content.description: Sit start with opposing sloper sidepulls and a left kneebar. Move into a left hand undercling and make a powerful move to the obvious Speed Bump rail. Work the heel hooks and pull onto and over the lip to the easy but loose topout.  Best to get to there early as the "speed bump" and small crimps above catch direct sun.
content.protection: Pad, roof is close to the ground and the topout is easy.  Easy climb to work by yourself.
content.location: Left side of the obvious roof as you enter the new meadow from the slot.  Once you emerge from the slot past Rudy & King Cobra look for the low roof on your right.

content.description: Just to the right of speed bump, toe hook till you bleed.

Start with low, poor opposing slopers (compression). Go straight up to easier terrain.

 This one is not instructed to sit start so starting crouched is "fair game", unlike Speed Bump.
content.location: Obvious compression line to the right of Shower Cap

content.description: Starts to the left of King Cobra as you are looking at the wall. Start on a good crimp and move right past slopers to a powerful undercling move. From here merge into the slopers and undercling jug of King Cobra. Would get more stars if it was a more independent line.
start on far left traverse right on slopey cool holds, or kill all the fun and grab the lip(im guessing the FAist considered the lip off)
content.protection: very low ball, maybe a pad
content.location: on same boulder as mother trucker, on the backside (walk towards beer can traverse look right)

content.description:
If you're standing in the cave below King Cobra/Redneck Hole, turn 180 degrees and look at the opposite (east-facing) wall. This problem climbs through chocolate-brown rock near the left edge of that face, about 20 feet from King Cobra. 

  Hard moves getting up into an undercling/rooflet feature off the ground. I remember climbing up the face, making awkward moves into a scoop, and being so pumped the first time through I had to bail left. The second time through I moved right out of the scoop, to top out on long reaches to incuts on the face. 

  Problem named for the graffiti (and diagram) already scratched into the rock when we found it. If it's still there, you can use it to educate yourself about where babies come from.

Start sitting with an obvious right facing sidepull. The crux is the first move, going from the start to the undercling rail with greased up feet. After the undercling, grab another right facing side pull then an easy top out.
content.location: This problem faces gumby and gumby direct on the small boulder just to the right of gumby. After getting through the tunnel to reach the new meadow, this problem will be on the right side (North).

content.description: This problem is in the shade all day.  Once you enter the meadow, hike up and left on slick slabs and over a boulder.  This problem starts in cave down and to the right on huge huecos to a difficult throw to a delicate topout.
starts on left hand chalked crimp (i palmed the wall with right)stand up on good feet long reaches to tiny protrusions
content.location: walking in from king cobra look left this is the chalked slab climb to the right of the dihedral

content.description: Sit start on the overhanging prow.  Step off to rock behind you once you've established on the vertical rock after the big throw to the jug.
content.location: This problem is on your right-hand side at the end of the corridor and before you enter the meadow proper.

content.description: Link to videoCopied & pasted from Instagram - @peril_by_misadventure - 01/12/2021:  "I found this about two weeks ago, brushed away the dirt, and pulled some very loose flakes of choss from the holds. Underneath lay solid edges and a great problem. It took me 3 sessions to send it, which confirms the grade IMO."The problem starts as for “perverse cowgirl” and heads directly up the roof."
content.location: From the New Meadow: Head northeast down the huge slabs towards the giant pond. Can't miss it. The problem can be seen from the top of the slabs. Shares the start with Perverse Cowgirl V6 and heads to the right, directly up the center of the overhang.

content.description: Start low traversing right with the flake up to the jug and top out.
Same start as Gumby Traverse. Start low traversing right, but go straight up to top out.
start on low good undercling hueco, climb face between two cracks(the left crack is formed by this boulder and 2 star arete boulder)
content.location: face problem between blackmail and gumby traverse.

content.description: Start on a good left side-pull and trend right through slopers and an undercling to a long move to the top-out jugs.
content.protection: A few pads and a spotter.
content.location: As you're walking past King Cobra, it'll be on your right just before you enter the meadow proper.

content.description: crimps on a sight overhang, big move to a right facing jug
content.location: climb the face to the right of 2 star arete

content.description: lowball, traverse, high dab potential, start at the back and head towards the meadow, traverse jugs and slopers, drop off when holds run out.
content.location: tucked around the corner from speed bump in a slot, starts at the furthest point you can reasonably squeeze to

content.description: Start with the arete, traverse left, top out in the scoop.
content.location: On the same boulder as Gumby, to the left of Mother Trucker.

content.description: Start on Lobster Claw and go left.  This thing looks way hard.
Mostly shady and sheltered, can get crowded around Lobster Claw and King Cobra.  Many V0-2 problems exist here as well, but are not included for clarity.
